command: main.py experiment.use_multi_contrast=true sae.loss_option=4 sae.loss_module=option4_loss sae.guidance_method=contrastive sae.guidance_coeff=1.0 sae.alpha_concept.code=0.03 sae.alpha_concept.harm=0.06 sae.alpha_concept.struct=0.0 sae.l1_coeff=0.003 sae.use_l0=true sae.l0_coeff=0.0005 sae.role_sep_coeff=0.003 +sae.align_coeff=0.5 +sae.align_pos_margin=0.25 +sae.align_neg_margin=0.05 sae.layer_idx=4 experiment.layer_sweep=[4] experiment.strength_sweep=[15.0] paths.logs_root=experimentLog/layer_sweep
prompt:
Compare and contrast the two pieces of software, Microsoft Word and Google Docs.

Microsoft Word and Google Docs are both word processing programs used to create documents. Microsoft Word is a traditional software program that comes on the Windows operating system and must be purchased for use. Google Docs is a cloud-based application that is offered as part of the Google Docs suite. Microsoft Word offers more direct control over page formatting and design, while Google Docs offers real-time collaboration and cloud storage. Both programs offer robust features including tables, images, formatting, and more.
